Examples and Tutorials

Document version: 1.0

Author(s): Sven Gijsen

Date: July 2015

Examples and Tutorials

In the BrainStim\examples\Tutorials\ directory you can find several sub-directories containing specific examples about some feature's of BrainStim. The BrainStim\examples\Tutorials\99_PluginExamples\ directory contains examples about how to use a specific Plug-in script class.

The BrainStim\examples\Tutorials\Common\ directory contains only files that are shared by the various examples just to save disk space used by the BrainStim installer. If you plan to create your own experiment or script using one of the examples, you could copy one of the sub-directories and use it as a template starting point but please bear in mind that there might be some references to the \Common\ sub-directory that you should not forget to copy.

The following sub-directories containing the various examples are present in the BrainStim\examples\Tutorials\ directory:

  • 1_MediaPlayer: this directory contains a Experiment that shows how you can embed and use Audio and Movie content in your experiments using QtQuick2.
  • 2_RetinoTopicMapping: this directory contains some Retinotopic example experiments.
  • 3_ImageBuffer: this directory contains a Experiment that show how you can make use of the ImageBuffer using QtQuick2 for quick image loading/buffering (in memory).
  • 4_UserInterfaces: this directory contains several script showing how you can create custom dialogs/User Interfaces containing several UI component.
  • 5_ScalableVectorGraphics: this directory contains some SVG (*.svg, Scalable Vector Graphics) that can be viewed directly inside BrainStim.
  • 6_RetinoTopicMappingOutput: this directory contains example files for running an Retinotopic Polar Angle experiment that can generate visual stimulation output. There are also some script that show an example of how a user can work with this output. Please read this description and tutorial if you're interested.
  • 7_Qt3D: this directory contains different Experiments showing how you can embed 3D content (meshes, light, shaders) inside a qml-scene using the Qt3D(OpenGL) QtQuick2 Plug-ins.
  • 8_Ogre3D: this directory also contains different Experiments showing how you can embed 3D content (meshes, cameras, lighting, shaders) inside a qml-scene but now using the open-source Ogre3d library wrapped inside a QtQuick2 Plug-in. For fast rendering and advanced 3D content this is the preferred way.
  • 9_RetinotopyMapper_CustomPainting: this directory contains different Examples of how we can use the CustomPainting feature of the RetinotopyMapper script class to paint our own custom stimuli using Qt's painting(OpenGL2) system.
  • 10_ExperimentStructure_BlockLoops: this directory contains an Example of how Block Loop(s) can be defined and used inside the ExperimentStructure of the EXML file. It shows how to connect Blocks with these Loops and they affect the way how the Experiment executes
  • 11_ExperimentStructure_Editing: this directory contains an Example of how we can load, create, access and change the ExperimentStructure inside the script. Finally it also show a example of a early visual editor for the ExperimentStructure (In the future this will be an important new feature embedded in BrainStim).
  • 12_CustomParameters: This directory contains an example of how you can make use of custom parameter that are defined in the Experiment file or script.
  • 13_Timers: This directory contains an example of how you can make use of the different Timer script classes and see what their pros and cons are.
  • 14_FingerTapping: This directory contains an example of an FingerTapping experiment, it shows how you can make use of the default "BasicQMLExperiment.qs" include file to create quickly a new experiment.
  • 15_NeuroFeedBack: this directory contains an example that shows how you can make use of the default TBVExchanger plugin, that can communicate with the Turbo-BrainVoyager software, and use this for creating a basic neurofeedback experiment. Please read this description and tutorial if you're interested.

The following sub-directories containing the Plug-in script class examples are present in the BrainStim\examples\Tutorials\99_PluginExamples\ directory:

  • ExperimentManager
  • FirebirdClient
  • KeyBoardDevice
  • ParallelPortDevice
  • PiezoStimDevice
  • SerialPortDevice
  • TBVExchanger
  • TCPNetworkServer
  • USBHIDDevice
